title: Institute of Psychiatry Department of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry
abstract: There has been a child psychiatry research group within the Institute of Psychiatry since 1952. At first it constituted a section of the Department of Psychiatry and for a while it formed part of the MRC Social Psychiatry Research Unit. However, in 1973 London University established a Chair of Child Psychiatry and since that time there has been a separate Department of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry. The research in this field undertaken up to 1967 has been described previously (Rutter, 1968 a ) and the present report brings the account up to date with a summary of work carried out during the last eight years.
